cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi coast) Sunday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near Morgan City to the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches begin east of Sabine Pass, TX and extend eastward to the Alabama/Florida border; Galveston is west of the watch area.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect along the Texas coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact expected from southeast Louisiana eastward to coastal Mississippi and Alabama; secondary, lower-end impacts possible along the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈23%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 35–45 mph possible late Sunday through Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding (generally <2 ft) possible at high tide; major surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could produce 1–3 inches of rain; localized higher totals possible but widespread 4-inch amounts are not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf beginning this weekend.
